senses.de: Known from past experience, or already seen or recognized

Tips.title: Experience Reinforcement
Tips.description: Think of 'familiar' to highlight personal experiences when you've encountered something before.
Tips.example: The streets of my hometown are familiar to me.

Tips.title: Recognition Cue
Tips.description: 'Familiar' is often used to express a feeling of vague recognition, even if details are forgotten.
Tips.example: His voice is familiar, but I can't remember his name.

senses.de: Friendly, like a close friend or family member

Tips.title: Warm Connection
Tips.description: Use 'familiar' to describe someone who behaves in a warm, friendly way, like a friend would.
Tips.example: The teacher’s familiar smile made the new student feel welcome.

Tips.title: Emotional Tone
Tips.description: 'Familiar' can convey a sense of comfort and ease in interactions, similar to being with close ones.
Tips.example: Their familiar banter reminded me of my siblings.

senses.de: In folklore, a supernatural being that helps and supports a witch or other person
senses.ex: Every witch has her own familiar.

Tips.title: Literary Device
Tips.description: In storytelling, 'familiar' might refer to magical companions, adding a mystical element.
Tips.example: The wizard's familiar was a wise, talking raven.

senses.ex: It's a familiar sight in this city.

Tips.title: Everyday Normality
Tips.description: 'Familiar' can suggest something is so common in everyday life that it's no longer noteworthy.
Tips.example: The familiar aroma of coffee wafts through the café.

Tips.title: Not Surprising
Tips.description: Use 'familiar' to indicate that a situation or object doesn't surprise you because of its regularity.
Tips.example: Rainy days are a familiar scene here in April.

senses.ex: His familiar behavior with his boss got him in trouble.

Tips.title: Informal Tone
Tips.description: 'Familiar' may suggest someone is being too casual and potentially disrespectful in a serious setting.
Tips.example: Your familiar remarks are inappropriate in a job interview.

Tips.title: Respect Boundaries
Tips.description: Being 'familiar' can mistakenly come off as rude if the level of intimacy isn't mutual.
Tips.example: He acted too familiar with guests he barely knew.

Accustom.wordDefinition:
Accustom means to become used to something or someone over time, while familiar means to have knowledge or recognition of something or someone.

Accustom is applicable when you are getting used to a new situation or adapting to changes, while familiar is applicable when you are recognizing something that you know well or have seen before.

For example, you might accustom yourself to living in a new city or familiarize yourself with a particular type of music.

Acquaint.wordDefinition:
Acquaint means to know or be familiar with someone or something, but not very well. For example, if you meet someone new, you would acquaint yourself with them by getting to know their name, where they are from, and what they do.

Acquaint means to know something or someone slightly, while familiar means to know something or someone well.

Common.wordDefinition:
Common means that something is widespread or exists in a lot of places.

It describes things we see or experience on a regular basis. For example, "Going to school is a common experience for teenagers.".

Common is used to indicate how often something occurs while familiar is used to indicate our personal experience or awareness of something.

Conversant.wordDefinition:
Conversant means having knowledge or experience in a particular subject or activity, whereas the word familiar means knowing something or someone well and in a personal way.

For example, if someone is conversant in French, it means they have a good understanding of the language and can speak it fluently.

Conversant describes a level of expertise or knowledge in a specific area. Familiar is more about having personal experience or recognition with something or someone.

Friend.wordDefinition:
Friend refers to someone you have a personal relationship with, and often implies a level of intimacy, trust, and shared interests.

A friend is someone you enjoy spending time with, someone you confide in, and someone who supports you.

In short, familiarity is simply knowing someone or something, while being a friend involves a deeper level of personal connection and relationship.

Intimate.wordDefinition:
Intimate refers to a close or personal relationship with someone whom you know well.

Familiar is a term for knowing something or someone well, whereas intimate describes a relationship that involves a strong emotional bond.

Recognize.wordDefinition:
Recognize means to acknowledge or identify something or someone that you have encountered before. For example, you might recognize a person you went to school with, even if you haven't seen them in years.

Familiar refers to something or someone you know well or have experience with, while recognize refers to identifying something or someone you have encountered before.

Routine.wordDefinition:
Routine refers to a set sequence of actions that is regularly followed. For instance, you have a morning routine where you brush your teeth, have breakfast, and get dressed before heading out to your day.

Familiar refers to something that is known, while routine refers to a set of actions you follow repeatedly.

Usual.wordDefinition:
Familiar means something that is well-known or easily recognized, while usual means something that is common or expected in a particular situation.

For example, a person's usual routine may involve waking up at a certain time, having breakfast, going to work or school, and returning home in the evening.

A familiar song is one that a person knows well and can sing along to easily, while a usual meal may be one that is commonly eaten in a particular culture or region.

Familiar refers to something that is known or recognized, while usual refers to something that is typical or expected in a particular context.

quotes.Text: Things go wrong for me all the time with technology. I'm not familiar enough with it, and I'm too old-school a brain to be able to figure it out. I'm dumb. Anything that I have to attack with my thumbs, for any period of time, makes me feel stupid. So, I try to avoid it, as much as possible, to protect my thumbs.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Johnny Depp

quotes.Text: From a football perspective, putting young footballers into art, or singing - you're doing something that's not so familiar. It has helped us build a team and build a spirit.
quotes.Title: English Businessman
quotes.Name: Graham Potter

quotes.Text: Part of the problem is when we bring in a new technology we expect it to be perfect in a way that we don't expect the world that we're familiar with to be perfect.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Esther Dyson

quotes.Text: To imagine a better life for yourself and your family and to leave behind all that is familiar requires a special kind of courage.
quotes.Title: Australian Businessman
quotes.Name: Frank Lowy

quotes.Text: There's a danger in anything that is unfamiliar. That's the world we live in.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mike Patton

quotes.Text: Watching familiar characters take unexpected turns is very appealing.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: Marc Platt

quotes.Text: I love finding ways to make familiar characters into someone unique.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Annaleigh Ashford

quotes.Text: And, more important, none of Paul's music feels unfamiliar to me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ednita Nazario

quotes.Text: Technological change is both familiar and easy to observe.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Annalee Newitz

quotes.Text: Few men have been admired of their familiars.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Michel de Montaigne
